Question 19: Was this person Seneca (Roman Stoic philosopher who lived from 4 BC to 65 AD)?

Given that Marcus Aurelius was primarily known as an emperor (which was ruled out by an earlier question), and Lucretius was more focused on natural philosophy (which was also ruled out), I'm going to make my final guess.
